name: df-evls1
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4
body: |- wceq(ces1, cmpo(s0, s1, universe, cpw(cfv(cbs, cv(s0))), csb(s2, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), ccom(cmpt(s3, co(cv(s2), cmap, co(cv(s2), cmap, c1o)), ccom(cv(s3), cmpt(s4, cv(s2), cxp(c1o, csn(cv(s4)))))), cfv(co(c1o, ces, cv(s0)), cv(s1))))))
bodyPretty: âŠ¢ evalSub1 =(s0 âˆˆ ð•Œ, s1 âˆˆ P((Base ` s0))â†¦[(Base ` s0)/ s2]((s3 âˆˆ(s2[â†¦](s2[â†¦]1o))â†¦(s3 âˆ˜(s4 âˆˆ s2 â†¦(1o Ã— { s4 }))))âˆ˜((1o[evalSub]s0)` s1)))
comment: Define the evaluation map for the univariate polynomial algebra. The function ` ( S evalSub1 R ) : V --> ( S ^m S ) ` makes sense when ` S ` is a ring and ` R ` is a subring of ` S ` , and where ` V ` is the set of polynomials in ` ( Poly1 `` R ) ` . This function maps an element of the formal polynomial algebra (with coefficients in ` R ` ) to a function from assignments to the variable from ` S ` into an element of ` S ` formed by evaluating the polynomial with the given assignment. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Jun-2015.)
